Description: Seat formed of a section of a tree, with trunk and four branches, all of which are bound with copper wire; the trunk has a cap of the same.
Curator's comments: Slip records an attribution to the Mangbetu, following Schweinfurth 'Artes Africanae' pl.XVII 17.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Af,+.989 to 1003.a were presented to the BM by the Khedive of Egypt (Isma'il Pasha) on 1 December 1878, and had all been previously shown in the Paris Exhibition of 1878.
